decision_conditions: It is recommended that the dead Beech, Opposite The Avenue may be felled, and the Scots Pine in the same location can have the overhang reduced by up to 2m.  The row of Robinia's running along the top of the concrete retaining wall to the rear of the footway of Station Lane can be crown lifted and overall crown reduced to previous pruning points.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description: 1) Fell dead beech tree that has branches overhanging pavement & road. 2)To cut back branches on large & tall scots pine tree on left, only by 6ft off the ends. 3) To reduce 2 x Rabinia trees crown by 30% or back to old cuts. 4) To crown lift lower branches on long row of Rabinia  tree's overhanging.
